title:
Dear God...

As I lie here in the dark of night, I hear a train in the distance slipping through the...

attachments.displayName:
Dear God...

As I lie here in the dark of night, I hear a train in the distance slipping through the night with the low, moaning sounds of a tired soul in search of rest. It seems to say, "My wheels are destined to take me wherever the tracks will lead. I must hurry." I often feel like that train in the night, rushing head-on as if propelled by some unseen force.

Although my soul searches for my own destination, I often allow the world to dictate my future. "Here is the track," the world tells me, "now all you have to do is follow it." After all, it's not easy to go one's own way, when following the crowd will take you in the direction so many others are going. It can be confusing. The "world" says its way is right. But You tell me to think for myself. I read Your scripture, and I remember with confidence that You have given me the gift of my choice. My circumstances are behind, around, and before me, but I choose the road I travel.

Though You have a plan for me, You still allow me to make my own choices, mistakes and all. What joy it is to know that at any moment I can break away from the hurried pace of the fast track of this world and rest serenely beside Your still waters.

object.content:
Dear God...

As I lie here in the dark of night, I hear a train in the distance slipping through the night with the low, moaning sounds of a tired soul in search of rest. It seems to say, "My wheels are destined to take me wherever the tracks will lead. I must hurry." I often feel like that train in the night, rushing head-on as if propelled by some unseen force.

Although my soul searches for my own destination, I often allow the world to dictate my future. "Here is the track," the world tells me, "now all you have to do is follow it." After all, it's not easy to go one's own way, when following the crowd will take you in the direction so many others are going. It can be confusing. The "world" says its way is right. But You tell me to think for myself. I read Your scripture, and I remember with confidence that You have given me the gift of my choice. My circumstances are behind, around, and before me, but I choose the road I travel.

Though You have a plan for me, You still allow me to make my own choices, mistakes and all. What joy it is to know that at any moment I can break away from the hurried pace of the fast track of this world and rest serenely beside Your still waters.
